messages: 30543bebd8db25d7f717b2ea58a9d4f7 (20:20): so i basically am using this code http://www.zurb.com/article/266/super-awesome-buttons-with-css3-and-rgba to make a cool button, i was wondering if anyone could tell me what the style name is to make that button fill an entire <td> cell would be
30543bebd8db25d7f717b2ea58a9d4f7 (20:20): css is kind of dead right now :\
30543bebd8db25d7f717b2ea58a9d4f7 (20:20): sorry that i keep pestering the channel
30543bebd8db25d7f717b2ea58a9d4f7 (20:21): ignorance on my part, thank you
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:25): hmm. so the new YouTube iframe has hard-coded width and height...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:32): are there other known-dangerous CSS properties than -moz-binding, binding and anything whose value has expression()?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:32): In terms of exposing arbitrary scripting, or does it count to kill a page's performance to unusability?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:33): I was just thinking about scripting
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:33): In that case, I don't *think* so.  I don't believe anyone runs scripts in SVG linked through CSS.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:33): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: are there properties that are so perf-sensitive that they should be cosidered dangerous?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:34): Sure.  Shadows can kill a page with 30+ second scroll times.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:36): I suspect it's possible to attack a page with the ~ combinator, too.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:37): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Do you care about things being dangerous to IE6 users?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:37): Apparently you can do things like list-style-image:url("javascript:alert('XSS')"); there
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:42): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: belies doesn't mean what you think it means
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:46): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: yeah, the weird non-escaping behaviour is intentional
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:47): (I think the unescaping behavior was weird)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:48): no kidding
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:59): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, MediaWiki blocks filter:, accelerator:, and url().  That's meant to prevent information leaks as well as scripting.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:59): accelerator?  What's that for?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:59): I have absolutely no idea.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:00): http://www.css3.com/css-accelerator/
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:00): finds http://apiblog.youtube.com/2010/07/new-way-to-embed-youtube-videos.html, yay!
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:00): subscribes to that blog
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:00): Yus, very nice.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:02): I really have to commend Apple for forcing people to switch to HTML5 video.  Awesome move on their part.  Too bad Google doesn't take the same stand.  Also too bad Apple is completely and irredeemably evil in other ways.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:02): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: What do I think it means? i.e. how did I use it?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:03): switches his forum to use the new YouTube embed style
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, the current YouTube embed code has hardcoded width and height too.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:05): Although a *different* hardcoded width and height, I think?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:09): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Surely nobody can be irredeemably evil
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:09): Not even Darth Vader was
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:10): Well, okay.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:10): I exaggerate.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:15): I love how Darth Vader is the Hitler of nerd-dom.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:16): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: If I invoke Godwin's law at this point, what happens?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:16): That just declares an argument to be over.  We aren't arguing yet, so it's a noop.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:17): I was hoping we could declare your position "I love how..." to be wrong
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:17): Hitler would have been a poor example to pick, since as far as I'm aware he was not redeemed before his death, so he would have contradicted my argument
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:17): Palpatine would have been an equally poor example
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:19): Hitler committed suicide, does that count?  Probably not.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:24): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: you used it to mean "reveals" but it really means "disguises"
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:26): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, where did he use it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:26): hybi
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:27): i only mention it because i keep trying to use the word but can't find a context in which it's correct to use it :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:28): "Dogs like it when you scratch their belies"
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:29): "I think the current discussion on this list belies a false belief that we are still at a stage where the protocol can be trivially changed."
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:29): Yeah, that's not right.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:29): It means the opposite.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:29): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: lol
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:37): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: why is the intrinsic size of captured images of more interest than the size in terms of file pixels?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:37): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: and when would they differ?

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I suspect I do that sort of thing quite often; anytime my general impression of where a word sounds good doesn't match its real meaning
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:40): I probably meant to say "betrays"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:43): http://jeffkreeftmeijer.com/2010/experimenting-with-node-js/ is fun
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:44): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, high resolution displays
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:44): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, though actually I suppose if you haven't given them a size...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:45): I'd expect the site to care about the file pixels when the user is about to upload an image
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:45): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Haha, that's awesome.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:46): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, yeah, I guess there is no difference, not sure what I was thinking
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:47): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, well, I looked at what HTMLImageElement and HTMLVideoElement did, but they are not too relevant
